name: MrBayes

inputs.name: filename
inputs.label: Output filename
inputs.help: Output files will be named this with .p, .t, .mcmc extensions. Use to avoid overwriting files when running repeated analyses on the same dataset.

inputs.name: outgroup
inputs.label: Outgroup
inputs.help: The name or number identifying one taxon from the data.

inputs.name: model
inputs.label: Choose model
inputs.help: Models are defined below and are only valid for nucleotide data.

inputs.name: rates
inputs.label: Choose rates
options: (propinv) A proportion of the sites are invariable
(invgamma) A proportion of the sites are invariable and the remaining sites are Gamma-distributed

inputs.name: samplefreq
inputs.label: Sample frequency
inputs.help: Frequency with which output it written to files.

inputs.name: printfreq
inputs.label: Print frequency
inputs.help: Frequency with which output is printed to the screen.

inputs.name: burninfrac
inputs.label: Burn-in fraction
inputs.help: Fraction of samples to discard when summarizing.

inputs.name: plot
inputs.label: Include plot?
inputs.help: Creates an x-y graph of the parameter over the course of the chain.

inputs.name: checkfreq
inputs.label: Checkpoint frequency
inputs.help: Frequency with which checkpoints are written. Used for continuing analysis with append.

inputs.name: append
inputs.label: Append to last checkpoint?
inputs.help: Requires .ckp file (i.e. that number of generations > checkpoint frequency for previous analysis).

inputs.name: seed
inputs.label: Seed
inputs.help: Specify a seed with which to run the job.

inputs.name: swapseed
inputs.label: Swap Seed
inputs.help: Specify a swap seed with which to run the job.

help:
This tool takes as input a Nexus file (.nex), described here, that should only contain a data block, without commands. If a command block exists in the file, it will be executed first, followed by the ones specified above.

What it does

MrBayes is a program for Bayesian inference and model choice across a wide range of phylogenetic and evolutionary models. MrBayes uses Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods to estimate the posterior distribution of model parameters.

See the manual or the command reference for more information.

Model Definitions

Models are defined by the following MrBayes options:

System Message: WARNING/2 (<string>, line 30)

Literal block expected; none found.

GTR: lset nst=6; SYM: lset nst=6; prset statefreqpr=fixed(equal); HKY85: lset nst=2; K2P: lset nst=2; prset statefreqpr=fixed(equal); F81: lset nst=1; JC69: lset nst=1; prset statefreqpr=fixed(equal); Mixed: lset nst=mixed;

Each model makes different assumptions about nucelotide substitution rates and state frequencies.

The mixed model performs Markov chain sampling over the space of all possible reversible substitution models, by grouping the six rates in various combinations.

Tip for repetitive analyses

Note that running the same analysis on the same dataset in Galaxy will overwrite .p, .t, and .mcmc files for that dataset. This can be avoided by copying the dataset or re-uploading it, or by specifying a new filename.

Tip for using append

If you want to use the append functionality, all parameters will have to be identical to your initial analysis. The easiest way to ensure this is by using the blue "Run this job again" arrow on the dataset, and checking the additional append box. Note also that ngen will be the total number of generations, not the number of generations to add, so you should increase this value except if a run was interrupted. Selecting append while checkfreq > ngen will have no effect.

Wrapper originally created by AAFC-MBB -> https://github.com/AAFC-MBB/

errors.data: parameter 'data': specify a dataset of the required format / build for parameter
